problem:
How can radioactive isotopes be used in biological research such as tracing the pathways of compounds synthesized in the living cell?

A. Labeling substance with radioactive isotopes is a powerful method for studying specific metabolic pathways, as well as being applicable to many other areas of biological research.

B. Radioactive isotopes are used for improving the flavor and texture of food products.

C. Radioactive isotopes are used to stimulate the immune system in organisms.

D. Radioactive isotopes are used to increase the oxygen-carrying capacity of blood.

E. Radioactive isotopes are used to enhance the growth of agricultural crops.

F. Radioactive isotopes are used as a direct nutrient supplement in animal diets.

G. Radioactive isotopes are primarily used to create glow-in-the-dark materials for scientific equipment.

H. Radioactive isotopes are used to provide energy for spacecrafts.

I. Radioactive isotopes are used to kill cancer cells.

J. Radioactive isotopes are used for dating archaeological samples.
